title: Astros' Carlos Correa has great reaction to his walk-off home run in Game 2 of ALCS
text:
CLOSE

The New York Yankees and Houston Astros battled in a near-five hour contest in Game 2 of the American League Championship Series.

The Carlos Correa led off the bottom of the 11th inning for Houston and hit the first pitch he saw well over the wall in right field, giving the Astros a 3-2 win that they so desperately needed.

Now the series is tied 1-1 as it shifts to New York on Tuesday night.

Yankees pitchers probably won't like the way Correa reacted to his home run, but it was well played.

He instantly knew it was gone and then ran to first with his hand around his ear to soak in the cheers.

On to Game 3.

HOUSTON, WE HAVE A WALK-OFF!!! pic.twitter.com/mGz9LZDEx5 — FOX Sports: MLB (@MLBONFOX) October 14, 2019
description: Carlos Correa didn't flip his bat, yet still had a great reaction to his walk-off home run in the 11th inning of Game 2.
